amount of embroidery thiread for the k2tog = knit two together s y face i used black ssk = slip slip knit sl =l slip o filling i like to use wool filling p © rs = right side o stitch marker or safety pin m ws wrong side o stitch holder o yarn needle ispecial stitches notes s o stockinette stitch = when working in o when choosing a worsted weight yarn keep row knit right side row and purl in mind that some worsted weights ©are very wrong side thick these thicker weight yarns will be gauge harder to work with for this project 13sts & 15 row over 2 5cm o when this pattern mentions leaving a long in stockinette stitch end…leave approx 20 © simply sycamore 2019 | all rights reserved 1 head using straight needles and the long tail cast on method cast on 6 stitches be sure to leave a long yarn end here you ll need it for stitching up later row 1 kfb six times rs row 2 p12 12sts ws e row 3 k1 * m1 k2 repeat from * to last st m1 k1 18sts r o row 4 p18 18sts m row 5 k2 * m1 k3 repeat from * to last st m1 k1 24sts row 6 p24 24sts a e c row 7 k3 * m1 k4 repeat from * to last st m1 k1 30srts y o row 8-12 work in stockinette stitch starting with a purl row 5 row s m a y e after completing row 12 stop and place a marker l c r p on the last stitch of the previous row i like to use y o a safety pin instead of a marker because it s a bit m s m smaller and stays out of the way i s y a e r ow 13 k1 * k2tog repeat lfrom * to last st k1 16sts c r p © y o row 14-16 work in stockinette stitch starting with a purl row 3 row m s m row 17 k1 * k2tog repeat from * to last st k1 9sts i s y a row 18 p9 9sts l c cut yarn leaving a long end using a yarn neepdle © y thread the end through the remaining stitmches and s pull to cinch
